intro: Amyris opobalsamum, commonly known as the sacred candle or sacred tree, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, evergreen leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces a fragrant resin that has been traditionally used in religious and medicinal practices. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long, slender leaves and clusters of fragrant flowers. Amyris opobalsamum is often cultivated in warm climates for its aesthetic appeal and historical significance.
